properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hot and humid conditions expected tonight into Friday. A hot and humid air mass will remain over the area into Friday. Daytime maximum temperatures near 29 degrees are expected along with an overnight minimum temperature near 18 degrees, providing little relief from the heat. A slightly cooler airmass is expected to arrive Friday night bringing cooler temperatures for the weekend. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-26T11:20:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T19:21:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0970804756.2019
Area: Attawapiskat, Fort Albany, Moosonee
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:22 p.m. CDT (5:22 p.m. EST, 6:22 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-26T02:07:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T22:22:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0749017254.2019

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert: Overland Flow Flood Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: The level of the Marten River is rising due to heavy rainfall and is causing flooding within the hamlet of Marten Beach. Highway eighty-eight is washed out north of the hamlet and closed. ### All residents are to evacuate and report to the reception centre set up at the Municipal District office. If you are unable to evacuate call 911. Transportation is available at the entrance to the hamlet if needed.
Expires: 2019-08-01T14:44:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124, 2019-07-25T14:43:26-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5950
Area: Lesser Slave River #124
properties.Author: Municipal District of Lesser Slave River No. 124

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms possible this evening. Thunderstorms have developed over northwestern Ontario and will continue this evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe and be capable of producing hail of 2 cm or greater. Strong wind gusts and heavy rain are also possible. Frequent lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-26T07:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T22:15:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0563726683.2019
Area: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:57 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm extends from Belleville towards Frankford and is moving south at 35 km/h. Hail along with heavy rain is expected. Locations impacted include: Belleville, Trenton, Rednersville, Frankford, Rossmore and Shannonville. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-26T00:50:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T21:58:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0226171269.2019

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures this evening will continue to be near 29 degrees Celsius, with the overnight temperatures forecast to remain above 14 degrees Celsius. The heat warning will come to an end Friday morning as Friday day time highs will be well below 29 degrees Celsius. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-26T12:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T21:27:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4145396966.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and damaging hail. A cold front tracking eastward across central and southern Manitoba is triggering thunderstorms as it progresses towards Ontario. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with the main threats being large hail and damaging winds. The thunderstorm activity is expected to exit the region early this evening. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-26T05:04:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-25T20:14:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1445804756.2019
Area: Poplar River, Berens River, Little Grand Rapids and Atikaki Prov. Park, Bloodvein
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and locally reduced visibilities at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-26T13:34:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-07-25T21:35:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3471572120.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
